sentence.Network_cn: 史密斯牧师将主持婚礼.

derivation.yuyuan_name: mid 17th cent.: from medieval Latin officiare 'perform divine service', from officium (see office)

entry.tran: 主持(仪式)；行使(指定的职务)
entry.def: When someone officiates at a ceremony or formal occasion, they are in charge and perform the official part of it.

example.ex: Bishop Silvester officiated at the funeral...
example.tran: 西尔韦斯特主教主持了葬礼。

example.ex: A memorial service was held yesterday at Wadhurst Parish Church. The Rev Michael Inch officiated.
example.tran: 昨天，悼念仪式在沃德赫斯特堂区教堂举行，迈克尔·英奇牧师担任主持。

entry.tran: （在体育比赛、竞赛等中）担任裁判
entry.def: When someone officiates at a sports match or competition, they are in charge and make sure the players do not break the rules.

example.ex: Mr Ellis was selected to officiate at a cup game between Grimsby and Rotherham...
example.tran: 埃利斯先生获选执法格里姆斯比队与罗瑟汉姆队的一场杯赛。

example.ex: Frik Burger will officiate when the Pumas play Scotland.
example.tran: 弗里克·伯格将担任阿根廷队对苏格兰队比赛的裁判。

means.word_mean: 1. act in an official capacity in a ceremony or religious ritual, such as a wedding;
2. perform duties attached to a particular office or place or function;

sentences.sentence: "His wife officiated as his private secretary"

auth_sentence.content: In Wales, he never refused the chance to officiate at charity matches as well as doing five consecutive Welsh Cup Finals.

auth_sentence.content: Now Paddy Power has offered to provide the money so that Mr Fenton can continue to officiate.

auth_sentence.content: The talks are understood to have gone well enough that Clattenburg may officiate again at Stamford Bridge this season.

auth_sentence.res_content_con: The talks are understood to have gone well enough that Clattenburg may officiate again at Stamford Bridge this season.
